PathOfBuilding.Notes:
Pros of this build -------------------------------------------- - One of the best opening weekend boss rushing / carry service builds, smooth progression into bossing - Scales into very high damage for not a huge amount of investment; huge single target once you get rolling - Flexible playstyle. You can build this as a giga-tank and still do considerable damage, or go zhp and do billions, or anywhere in between. - Suppression is the best Uber defense available, and Trickster gets the best version of suppression with additional effectiveness and caps it for no cost. - Highest damage potential ascendency (by a lot) for Explosive Trap outside of Assassin. - Pretty comfy scaling, all upgrades feel meaningful and you don't need mirrors to instantly delete Ubers
Cons of this build -------------------------------------------- - Some people don't like traps. If you don't like traps, this is not a build you will like - The trade-off to access both the power and defenses of Trickster, you have to manage your mana costs. - Mapping is servicable on the normal gem, but not amazing. Shrapnel transfigured gem mostly addresses this but it's AoE was nerfed by about 25% in 3.24 (It's still huge)
Act 1: -------------------------------------------- In 3.21 They nerfed level 1 Explosive Trap, removed Arcane Surge's spell damage, and removed the vendor recipe for wand flat dmg which slowed down leveling with Explosive Trap. You CAN still level with Explosive Trap if you are a one-skill-enjoyer, but it's a bit slower than the meta. For 3.25 I am again speed running campaign with ^x7070FFRolling Magma^7 into ^x7070FFArmageddon Brand^7 at level 28. Nothing has changed in that leveling meta this league. I'll use that all the way to early maps for clear. For Single Target I'll start using ^x70FF70Fire Trap^7 at level 12 and keep that until ^x70FF70Explosive Trap^7 starts outscaling it around level 75-80, or as soon as I'm able to source an ^x70FF70Explosive Trap of Shrapnel^7
Gem Progression is: Level 4: Buy ^x7070FFRolling Magma^7 + ^x7070FFElemental Proliferation^7 after Tidal Island. Buy ^x7070FFFlame Wall^7. Shoot your Magma balls through the flame wall to get additional flat fire dmg. Level 8: Get an added damage support for whichever links you are able to find, either ^x70FF70Added Cold Damage^7 or ^x7070FFAdded Lightning Damage^7, then once you kill Brutus grab ^x7070FFCombustion^7 from vendor Level 12: Pick up ^x70FF70Fire Trap^7 for single target. Link it with ^x70FF70Trap and Mine Damage^7 as soon as you complete Yeena's quest in A2
^xE05030IMPORTANT^7 - ^xFFFF77BEFORE BRUTUS^7 - Since they removed the vendor wands and Arcane Surge has lost 10% more spell damage, you need to make sure you grab a ^x70FF70^x7070FFBB^7^x70FF70G^7 or ^x70FF70^x7070FFBBB^7^7 link ^xFFFF77BEFORE^7 you fight Brutus and a Goat Horn or two for added flat damage to spells implicit. The third link for added damage with Rolling Magma makes a big difference.
^xE05030ALSO IMPORTANT^7 - Because the vendor wand craft is gone, it's now worthwhile to pick up and ID all caster base weapons if you don't mind the delay. Rune Daggers, Wands, Sceptres, etc. can all roll flat added spell damage. At ilvl 20, it's roughly 22% of the mod pool to hit some tier of added flat damage to spells. In the meantime, grab ^xFFFF77Goat Horn^7s before you fight Brutus to make the fight very easy. Once you get to A3 Dialla you can bench added flat fire damage to one or both weapons and use those for the remainder of the campaign.
^xE05030OFFHAND GEM LEVELING^7 - Before you get too deep into campain, purchase a three green socket weapon swap for both slots. You'll want to buy 6x ^x70FF70Explosive Traps ^7and level them as you progress through acts. If you forget, it's not a huge deal just make sure you grab them from the A1 vendor who will level the gems for you as you progress up to level 15. It's important to get quality on your gems BEFORE you vaal them. Quality is worth roughly double the damage an extra level would be, and that means you should value a 20/20 gem over a 21/0. You can get cheap quality by running the first lab and the font if you are SSF
Vendor Search Strings: --------------------------------------------- Movement speed boots + BBB / GGG / GGB + gem levels "b-b-b|g-g-b|g-[gb]-g|b-g-g|nne|rint|ll g|Earn"
Act 2: --------------------------------------------
Your links at this point should be ^x7070FFRolling Magma^7 + ^x7070FFElemental Proliferation^7 + ^x7070FFCombustion^7 for clear and ^x70FF70Fire Trap^7 + ^x70FF70Trap and Mine Damage^7 + ^x70FF70Swift Assembly^7 We'll be scaling that from here on out. You'll use this all the way through early maps until around level 75 when ^x70FF70Explosive Trap^7 starts to outscale it.
Bandits --------------------------------------------- I personally will be taking the 8% movement speed buff from Kraityn, but there isn't a wrong choice here in my opinion. If you'd like to be tankier, take +40 life from Oak. If you find gearing up resistances more difficult, Alira is still a fine choice. Choose the one most likely to make your campaign experience more enjoyable. If you are a new player, I'd recommend taking Oak and the +40 life.
Act 3: --------------------------------------------- Once you get to Solaris Temple Level 2 go into the Eternal Lab and grab the bench craft for Fire Damage. It's a huge dps boost for only a few transmutes. I used this craft + a level 4 wand all the way through campaign into maps.
At level 28 you can swap Rolling Magma for Armageddon Brand from A3 Library. It feels AMAZING through campaign and we are already scaling fire damage and elemental damage on our tree so you don't need brand wheels for it to shine. I'll use ^x7070FFArmageddon Brand^7 + ^x7070FFElemental Proliferation^7 + ^x7070FFCombustion^7 for clear all the way through white and yellow maps. The reason for using Arma brand is the clear is incredible and a cast time of 0.36s (vs. a trap skill in campaign which is closer to 0.9s) means it is a very comfortable move-while-killing-things combination.
Act 4: --------------------------------------------- Make sure you grab^x70FF70 Grace^7 and equip one from here on out. You'll feel too squishy as you make progress into late campaign without it. Periodically you'll want to fish for better ^x70FF70EVASION^7 and/or ^x7070FFENERGY SHIELD^7 bases as you can off the ground, prioritizing your Chest Piece. This will keep you comfortably alive during the remainder of the campaign.
^xE05030YOUR FIRST ASCENDENCY^7 should be One Step Ahead. It's an amazing QoL to have the extra action speed, be chill and freeze immune, and slow down enemies.
Act 7-9: --------------------------------------------- Around A7-9 4L your ^x70FF70Fire Trap^7 setup by adding an ^xE05030Inspiration^7. It will reduce mana pressure and make the end of campaign very smooth. You want ^x70FF70GGG^7^7^x70FF70^7^xE05030R^7 on any piece of gear. You'll also want to 4L your Armageddon Brand with ^xE05030Fire Penetration^7 if you are ok on Mana, and ^xE05030Inspiration^7 if you need more mana help. This will be a ^x7070FFBBB^7^xE05030R^7 piece of gear.
^xE05030YOUR SECOND ASCENDENCY^7 should be Polymath. This provides a substantial damage increase and sustain. All the way up until you find an ^xFFFF77Alternating Sceptre^7 you will benefit from the life/es/mana recovery from Polymath as your Armageddon Brand and Fire Trap both Ignite, and DoT damage kills count as you even with traps.
White / Early Maps -------------------------------------------- As SOON as you can you will want to source T1/T2 bases to replace the campaign trash you are almost certainly wearing. An Essence of Woe looking for a decent Life roll will go a long way in keeping you alive.
^xAF6025Wyrmsign^7 will full carry you all the way through T16s and they are dirt cheap even on league start. Good corruptions can be had too.
^xFFFF77ASAP^7 Craft two +1 gems ^xFFFF77Sceptres^7 or ^xFFFF77Rune Daggers^7 (depending on what movement skill you prefer). You can do this buy purchasing +x% quality gems that are tagged ^xB97123^xE05030Fire^7^7 off of trade (i.e., Blazing Salvo, Armageddon Brand, Fire Trap, etc.). These drop all the time and can be bought for alchemy orbs. You need 40% combined with a FIRE tag and you can vendor a WHITE sceptre with the gems to get back a ^x8888FFmagic^7 sceptre with ^xE05030+1 Fire Spell Skill Gems^7 on it. This is a substantial early maps dps boost and should be done right away. After you get it back from the vendor use an Orb of Augmentation to get a second mod, then a Regal Orb to get a third mod, then bench the highest tier of ^xE05030^xC8C8C8^x8888FF^xE05030Added Fire Damage to Spells^7^7^7^7. You'll keep this benchcraft until you transition to crit later in maps.
You should use Fire Trap until you start switching to crit around level 75. To get more damage early bench the next tier T2 of flat ^xE05030Added Fire Damage To Spells^7 on your weapon(s) ASAP. Fire Trap and Arma Brand both have excellent effectiveness of added damage and this is a significant increase to it (260% and 200%, respectively). Look for natural rolls of it on caster weapons and use those to unlocking another offensive benchable mod too, I'll usually have a natural roll of this by the time I'm in White Maps since flat added damage for spells is very common. NOTE: ^xE05030Added Fire Damage^7 does NOT work, it HAS to be ^xE05030Added Fire Damage To Spells^7
Next fix your flasks as they're almost certainly terrible out of campaign. Get a Jade flask (important!) because all of the synergy with ES / Trickster / Ghost Dance relies on a good Evasion pool. A spirit shield with a single Essence of Scorn is also a very strong source of crit chance, defense, and additional ES.
Find a belt you like (Crystal is lovely, Stygians are great too) and hit it with an Essence of Zeal of any tier to grant a high roll of Trap Throwing Speed. You should be comfortable with that gear into red maps. I'll also be shopping for a ^xAF6025Sunblast^7 and will take the first one I find with any non-bottom roll. This will be the one piece of gear I'll constantly be shopping for a better roll for as the difference between a low roll and a high roll is substantial. IMPORTANT: The roll range on your ^xAF6025Sunblast^7 is extremely important; I would not play with a low (50-60%) ^xAF6025Sunblast^7 it feels terrible. Look for something mid-60%+ if you can.
When to switch to Explosive Trap -------------------------------------------- I typically will keep ^x70FF70Fire Trap^7 through early yellow maps and switch to ^x70FF70Explosive Trap^7 the instant it starts outscaling ^x70FF70Fire Trap^7, which is somewhere around level 75 if you have been keeping up with leveling the gem in your offhand. If you haven't, stop by the Act 1 vendor (IMPORTANT: not Lilly in A5) and she will give you a partially leveled gem you can level. ^x70FF70Explosive Trap^7 scales HARD with levels, so if you have an under leveled ^x70FF70Explosive Trap^7 gem don't use it, instead either go find an appropriately leveled one off of trade or work on leveling your own.
Everyone will be swapping Green gems to random other Green gems as part of their first/second labs, so I expect ^x70FF70Explosive Trap of Shrapnel^7 to be easily available on league start. Historically this has been fairly cheap and will be again in 3.26. I'd recommend getting a gem and trying it out. See if you prefer the clear from Shrapnel or the slightly better single target for the non-transfigured gem.
As SOON as you switch to ^x70FF70Explosive Trap^7, go run a few low level Labs and get the quality up to 20%. It's between 20-30% more damage, depending on what level your gem is.
If I'm able to source Brittle from somewhere (^xFFFF77Alternating Sceptre^7, ^xAF6025The Interrogation^7 jewel, ^xAF6025Galesight^7, and ^xAF6025Leadership's Price^7^7 too though I wouldn't recommend it) I'll swap to ^x70FF70Explosive Trap^7 immediately. Brittle is such a massive damage boost that you don't want to miss out on it and Fire Trap cannot take advantage of it without a Leadership's Price.
Brittle -------------------------------------------- Brittle grants a ton of base crit, you want it. Options for it include (in priority order) 1. ^xFFFF77Alternating Sceptre^7 2. ^xAF6025The Interrogation^7 3. ^xAF6025Galesight^7 4. ^xAF6025Leadership's Price^7 (SSF farmable with Twins contract, pain to setup stats) 5. Mercenary Brittle Ground boots 6. Brittle Ground boots on yourself
But I can't get/find a source for Brittle!?! -------------------------------------------- Focus on gear affixes like ^x8888FFIncreased Critical Strike Chance for Spells^7, get a Crit medium cluster they are pretty easy to roll something that grants increased crit chance, Grab Power Charges on the tree, make SURE you have Infused on the tree.
Recipe for mitigating Mana Costs -------------------------------------------- For a 4L: Run Inspiration in your links and use a Mana Flask. Enduring mana flasks are ideal. Once you get to the Life mastery you can take it if you have some amount of life regen on gear, but a mana flask works fine. Run a low level ^x7070FFClarity^7 between 5-10 for a bit of extra regen, you can link ^x7070FFClarity^7 to ^xE05030Arrogance^7 too. For a 5L: You want a 20% Inspiration + Dreamer annointed + Life mastery for Skills Cost 15% Life Instead of Mana. Quality your Inspiration in lab. If you don't have some source of flat life regen to offset the life mastery, look for some on gear or maybe run a level 10 ^xE05030Vitality^7 + ^xE05030Arrogance^7. Stone Golem is nice but he's squishy and can't be relied on all the time, though I'll definitely still run one through the campaign and into white maps. Run a low level ^x7070FFClarity^7 between 3-10 for a small bit of extra regen. For a 6L: You want 20% Inspiration, Dreamer annointed, and Elreon crafts on your 2x rings and amulet and the Life mastery for Skills Cost 15% Life Instead of Mana. If you don't have some source of flat life regen to offset the life mastery, look for some on gear or maybe run a level 10 ^xE05030Vitality^7 + ^xE05030Arrogance^7. Stone Golem is nice but he's squishy and can't be relied on all the time, though I'll definitely still run one through the campaign and into white maps. Run a low level Clarity between 3-10 for a small bit of extra regen.
For a bit more budget there are other options, but these are nearly free or very cheap.
^xFFFF77ASCENDENCY ORDER^7 ------------------------------------------- 1. One Step Ahead 2. Polymath 3. Escape Artist 4. Spellbreaker
When I get into Late maps / bossing, I will switch out of One Step Ahead and over to Swift Killer, particularly if I've acquired a Sunblast. The additional Frenzy charges are nice but the REAL improvement is the 200% charge duration. With this you'll have your charges up basically forever unless you AFK, and it's important if you have a ^xAF6025Sunblast^7 as your ability to generate charges is gated behind ^x7070FFSkitterbots^7 proc'ing.
Check the endgame PoB in the description of the build guide video for pushing damage further and starting to boss.
^xFFFF77IMPORTANT FOR DEFENSES:^7 If you feel too squishy, try some of these things (1) Equip a shield. Ideally an ES base. Hit it with an Essence of Scorn to get crit chance and/or look for life/ES and +1 to Fire skill gems. Once you go Explosive Trap, Phys or Fire both work. (2) Recoup is INCREDIBLE for recovery. You have close access to two wheels, one by Circle of Life and one by Vampirism. I'd prioritize them in that order (3) Prioritize Flat Life Regen on gear in addition to Recoup for recovery. This also feels great. I used Flat Life Regen on gear + both Recoup wheels to push late into 3.23 Gauntlet, it will feel even better in SC (4) If you aren't using ^xE05030Enduring Composure^7 you should be. Endu charges were greatly buffed this league and Swift Killer+Endu Composure means high uptime. ^xE05030Enduring Cry^7 is an alternative if you prefer more buttons and want the jewel socket back. (5) Heartstopper^7 is an amazing defensive layer and can be traded for ^xAF6025^x70FF70Polymath^7^7. You'll lose about 12% of your damage. (6) You can take additional Life and Life/ES wheels for better hit mitigation. These are at ^x70FF70Revenge of the Hunted^7 and ^x70FF70Melding^7. Revenge of the Hunted is a better value at 3 passive points.
Good early/SSF unique options ------------------------------------------- - ^xAF6025Wyrmsign^7 is a fantastic offensive piece of early equipment. 1 alchemy, usually, and provides a free 5-link in your gloves with Rampage. I used a pair of these with a corruption (+2 AoE gems) all the way up to doing Shaper carries in 3.24, these are very strong - ^xAF6025Nycta's Lantern^7 is an excellent low cost weapon. It will often be several chaos the first half day or so and will trend towards alchemy territory. Battlemage is strong. - ^xAF6025Praxis^7 dropping means you don't have to care about mana anymore until late game
Mid Game Gearing ------------------------------------------- - I've left a shield and off-hand sceptre option, one will be tankier one is more dps. - ASAP I would start hunting for ^xD02090any corrupted +2 gems^7 (either +2 AoE or +2 Trap or Mine gems) chest. This is a SUBSTANTIAL damage increase and can be six linked with tainted fusings and colored with tainted chromatics. Some options are ^xAF6025Kintsugi^7, ^xAF6025Lightning Coil^7, ^xAF6025Cospri's Will^7 (extra curse, squishy), ^xAF6025Queen of the Forest^7^7, ^xAF6025Shadowstitch^7, ^xAF6025Tinkerskin^7 or ^xAF6025Restless Ward^7, and Ultimatum poops out tons ^xFFFF77Rares^7 with these corruptions. The Ultimatum ^xFFFF77Rares^7 are everywhere, but they will make you squishier than a high evasion base or tanky chest like a ^xAF6025Kintsugi^7 or ^xAF6025Lightning Coil^7. Be aware of that, it's only really good for pushing dps gated content early at the cost of your portals. - The rings are two mod rings + an unveiled prefix with an open benchable prefix. These will drop in betrayal and can be bought off trade from as low as a few chaos, depending on what other mods you care about. It's a 1/3 to unveil the 6-7% reduced mana cost of skills prefix, just make sure you don't have mana blocked. Bench life to block the life unveil, then bench the Elreon craft afterwards. THESE ARE NOT NECESSARY IF YOU DON'T WANT THEM, OTHER OPTIONS: - Dreamer annointment on amulet - Low level Clarity - Level 1 Clarity + Watcher's Eye with -mana cost of skills - Impossible Escape, Necromantic Aegis (for dreamer wheel) - Impossible Escape, Glancing Blows (for tireless wheel) - Look for useful fractures for weapons (+1 phys, +1 fire, +80+ spell damage, +30+ crit multi, +80+ spell crit chance) and Essence for another good mod and bench a 4th for a very good weapon for not a lot of currency. - Phys 8-mod cluster can be made by purchasing an ilvl 50-67 Phys Large Cluster and hitting it with a few one-socket jagged fossils. All 3-mod phys combos are sellable - Crit medium cluster can be crafted easily with Harvest targeting Lightning (for Eye of the Storm). Several of the other notables are good, Eye of the Storm is the best
Transfigured Gem (^x70FF70Explosive Trap of Shrapnel^7) ------------------------------------------- - If at ANY POINT you drop / acquire one, I would immediately equip it, even if you are still in the Fire Trap campaign phase provided it's a reasonable gem level. Make sure you 20% quality it by running the lowest level lab as that is a huge damage boost (20-30% more damage, depending) - AoE was nerfed by about 25% in 3.24, and damage was reduced by 10-15% from the 3.23 Shrapnel numbers, but the trap is mechanically superior and will get a signficant damage boost from its abillity to contract available secondary explosion radius to force more overlaps and additional ailment effect. - Testing in 3.24 showed that the transfigured gem outperformed the normal gem in nearly all mapping situations and conditionally in bossing encounters. For highly mobile targets, like the Constrictor, the Shrapnel gem will perform better. For more stationary targets like Uber Shaper, the normal gem will perform better. - Shrapnel has a higher variance across hits because of the reduced number of overlaps relative to the normal gem. You might prefer the normal gem mapping if you don't care as much about full screen clear and would prefer more consistent single target uptime on Rares. The damage is comparable, though the effective maximum dps is higher across a larger area with Shrapnel. Use the one that feels better for your play style, there isn't a "wrong" answer. ^xFFFF77Try both for yourself^7 is the key takeaway.
^xD02090Mercenaries^7 / ^xD02090Animate Guardian^7 ideas ------------------------------------------- Speculative since we haven't seen them yet, but I'd personally want a Mercenary that assists with ^xFFFF77Clear^7 for progression. Here are some things that _might_ be worthwhile: - Gravebind + Explode Crusader chest. Might want AoE on gear somewhere too since there is no passive tree for Mercs - Bow skill with additional arrows / chain / ^xAF6025Fury Valve^7 - Some good ideas here from Dreamcore: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=spnVEF2H8wQ - More good ideas from Dreamcore: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0OW0PO51bOM
^xFFFF77IMPORTANT^7: Mercenaries are like having a half-player in the map with you. You probably DONT want them in Uber/Bossing fights as they will increase HP by 50%.
^xD02090HELP!! My damage is low!!^7 ------------------------------------------- - Do you have affixes that are helpful on your weapon(s)/shield? ^x8888FFGem levels^7, ^x8888FFSpell Damage^7, ^x8888FFCrit Chance For Spells^7, ^x8888FFCrit Multi^7, ^x8888FFTrap Throwing Speed^7, and ^x8888FFAdded Flat Damage to Spells^7 are all good and in that priority order - Do you have a combined total of 50% Physical Damage Converted to Cold? If not, that's priority 1 once you have Explosive Trap equipped. Gloves (bench) + Tree are enough. - What gem level is your Explosive Trap? If it's not 20 or 21, go buy one that is 20 minimum - Have you gotten 20% quality on your gem? If not, go run first lab a few times and get 20% quality. It's ~20% more damage, and closer to ~30% more at lower levels - Check the gem links for wherever you are progression wise. Do you have the right supports? - Are you crit capped? - Is your crit capping conditional? Meaning, are you way under without your flasks? If so, consider swapping in a crit medium cluster. More consistent crit chance will feel a lot better - Did you allocate the 50% effect of crit ailments? If not, do that now. It's very strong for Brittle and works with Traps (I have tested this several times) - Do you have Traps Cannot Be Damaged as a Trap mastery? For many boss encounters, they will create an AoE that CAN DESTROY YOUR 1hp TRAPS. Guardians in particular (Constrictor/Eradicator/Enslaver/etc) - Do you have your mana sorted out? If not, running out of mana will brick your ability to damage. See the build guide video for recipes to mitigate with a 5L and a 6L - If you have a ^xAF6025Sunblast^7, are you overthrowing your traps? This can lead to a loss in damage that is hard to detect. Make sure that you don't combine ^x70FF70Swift Assembly^7 with this unique. See build guide video for more info.
^xD02090HELP!! I'm too squishy!!^7 ------------------------------------------- - Are you Spell Suppression capped? This is probably the #1 thing I saw in PoBs where people said they were squishy in maps - See the ^xFFFF77IMPORTANT FOR DEFENSES^7 section above, do some or all of those things - Do you have Ghost Dance and a decent ES pool (1k+)? - For Ghost Dance to be effective, you need a decent Evasion pool. Is it 30k+? - Do you have some amount of Flat Life Regen somewhere (or Stone Golem/Arrogance+Vitality) if you are using the Pay Casting Costs with Life? - Is your guard skill the correct level? I personally like a CWDT at level 2 and Immortal Call at level 4 - Do you have a source for ^xE05030Endurance Charges^7 like ^xE05030Enduring Composure^7 on a small cluster? If not, grab a small Armour cluster and spend ~50 alts to roll it, Endurance Charges were massively buffed in 3.25 - Are you using correct item bases? Armour won't be impactful unless you get a few thousand, you want Energy Shield on your hat/gloves/boots and Evasion everywhere else, or some combination of those.
^xD02090Higher budget defensive items^7 ------------------------------------------- - ^xAF6025Replica Badge of the Brotherhood^7 is always amazing, but might be more expensive in 3.26 with the popularity of other builds. No fortification downside, and you'll want something like ^xE05030Enduring Composure^7 to generate them. - the ^xAF6025Dark Seer^7 last league was huge defensively, particularly in T17s. Look for ^xE05030Life^7/^x7070FFEnergy Shield^7 rolls (there is also a Mana roll one that's less helpful). These will probably be expensive opening weekend.
